fields.name: Succulent
fields.description: This is a hardy plant that enjoys environments with high moisture content and low light conditions. These plants are great for bathrooms, bookshelves and other areas that don't typically get too much light.

fields.name: Ficus Elastica 'Robusta' (Rubber Plant)
fields.description:
Ficus elastica ‘Robusta’ (Rubber Plant) in 21cm Pot
From the Ornamental Fig family, the rubber plant has been a popular houseplant from the Victorian times, but now there are newer and better varieties like this form with larger, and wider glossy leaves. Although we recommend that it is grown in bright but indirect light, rubber plants will tolerate a couple of hours of morning sunshine.

These are easy plants to care for as long as you are careful with the watering. Only water once the compost is dry to touch, and make sure that the plant isn’t left standing in water. You can mist the leaves during the summer to increase the humidity. Occasionally wash the leaves with a damp sponge or cloth to keep the foliage glossy. Try to maintain an average temperature no lower than 12°C in the winter, and avoid any sudden drops in the temperature and cold draughts.

Supplied in a 21cm pot

Height 85cm

fields.name: Ficus Elastica 'Belize' (Rubber Plant)
fields.description:
Ficus elastica ‘Belize’ (Rubber Plant)
Part of the fig family this is a gorgeous plant with stunning variegated green leaves that have a touch of pink and white at the edges. The Belize is surprisingly easy to care for just needing some regular maintenance to keep it looking amazing. It not only looks great but is good at purifying the air.

Light conditions: indirect, bright light
Watering: Water weekly throughout the warmer months but only if the soil is dry to touch – get it wrong and this plant will let you know by dropping its leaves. Water less frequently during the cooler months. Do not allow soil to become soggy as this could damage the roots.
Rate of growth: fast growing, in the right conditions. You can expect a height of around 1 to 1.5m for a well-cared (and not regularly pruned) Constant pruning will help encourage new growth off the sides of the central stem.
Temperature: keep at normal room temperature, avoid cold draughts and sudden changes in temperature. Do not allow the temperature to drop below 12°C during the winter months.
Supplied in a 17cm pot

fields.name: Howea Forsteriana (Kentia Palm)
fields.description:
One of the most popular palms which if you stepped back into the Victorian times would have been seen in many a drawing room. They are still popular today as they are easy to grow, evergreen and will complement most rooms. Keep them away from direct sunlight as this can burn the leaves, and away from cold draughts.

The golden rule is not to leave this plant sitting in water- they like moist soil but won’t like to have the roots being sodden so feel the top of the soil before watering. In the winter it will still need watering but not as much. It likes humidity, so mist the leaves regularly in hot weather or if it is in a warm room.

Avoid repotting until it is really potbound as they don’t like to be disturbed.

Supplied in a 24cm pot

Height 150cm

fields.name: Ceropegia woodii (String of Hearts)
fields.description:
Ceropegia Woodii or String of Hearts plant is a real beauty. Nicknamed ‘String of Hearts’ due to its beautiful heart-shaped leaves.

Care:

Don’t overwater. Let the plant dry out in between waterings.
Likes bright indirect light.
Feed once a fortnight every month during the summer.

Supplied in a 6cm pot

fields.name: Crassula marnieriana 'Hottentot'
fields.description:
Crassula marnieriana Hottentot, often referred to as Jade Necklace Vine, grows in a cute stack of thick, petite leaves. Hottentot is a trailing crassula, so it looks fantastic when planted on the edges of containers.

Supplied in a 6cm pot

fields.name: Echeveria Parva
fields.description:
Echeveria parva succulents are great little survivors.  Parva offers unique coloring, with icy blue-green rosettes trimmed in blood red accents. ‘Parva’ means dwarf in Latin, so it makes sense that Echeveria parva succulents are a small variety. However, the rosettes are extremely dense, to the extent that they are compared to cabbages. The succulents also delight with golden, bell-shaped flowers on long stems.

Supplied in a 6cm pot

fields.name: Echeveria ‘Pluto Galaxy’
fields.description:
Most succulents are very easy to care for if you follow a few basic rules. First of all, never leave water on the leaves and in the plate. Second, the dead leaves are broken so that the succulent plant can grow beautifully.

Location:  in full sun and partial shade.

Humidity : Tolerates heat and drought well. Water moderately, letting the soil dry between waterings. 

Caution , lack of care or aging can cause the leaves to dry out and fall off. These must be cut in order to restore the plant.

Supplied in a 6cm pot

fields.name: Hoya linearis (Wax Plant)
fields.description:
The long, slender foliage of this hoya create a cascading effect along the length of the trailing stems, and if the plant receives enough light, it may also produce clusters of sweetly scented wax-like cream coloured flowers.

Care
Light: bright indirect light
Water: Summer: always keep the soil moist but not waterlogged. Winter: water less often, just giving it a good drink when the soil gets reasonably dry. Mist the leaves with water, especially if they are growing near central heating
Temperature: Maintain temperatures above 10C in winter.
Supplied in a 12cm pot

fields.name: Crassula ovata ‘Sunset’ (Jade Plant)
fields.description:
Crassula ovata ‘Sunset’ is a brightly coloured variety of the popular jade plant. Like the original green-leaved species, it makes a great house plant and is easy to look after. Give it plenty of light to maintain best leaf colour.

Supplied in a 12cm pot

fields.name: Opuntia vulgaris (Prickly Pear Cactus)
fields.description:
Opuntia vulgaris is a form of prickly pear succulent which has a few spines. It likes to occupy free-draining compost and will enjoy a sunny position.

Supplied in 17cm pot

Height 40cm
